dt-example.title: Predefined States
dt-example.info:
This example shows how predefined states can be supplied using the `-init stateRestore`extension. The state present under the `Saved States` button contains a predefined state that will scroll the table and apply an order to the third column.
Renaming, updating and deleting this state could all be disabled using the `-init stateRestore.rename`, `-init stateRestore.save` and `-init stateRestore.delete` options. Because it is built into the ajax data that is sent initially, the state will always be present on a new page load, even if it has been deleted previously.
